coded_answer.p: I have recently seen "Over the rainbow" and I must tell you that I'm really disappointed! I found the advertisement about this show in a newspaper and thought it would be fun.

I like Danny Brook as an actor and when I read that he would be starring, I booked the ticket imagetlyimmediately. But, instead there was a different actor, who I never heardhad never heard aboutof before!
The show should starthave started at 19.30, but it didn't start until 20.15! So, because of that, I missed my last bus home!
While we were waiting for the show to start, we were thinking of going to the restaurant. In factHowever, it was closed the whole evening, because of some work being done to it.
As I'm a student, I usually get discounts on differentvarious things, so I was so disappointed when I couldn't get itone herethere!
I'm really upset and disappointed after all this and at least I wantI want at least my money back!
It could have been a perfect evening out, but it wasn't!
How has modern technology changed my daily life?

I belong to thisthe generation who hadhave grown up with a lot of differentnew technolgytechnology. For example, TV, telephone, micrownmicrowave etc. But in the last few years, it has changechanged and so many new important things hadhave been discoveredinvented. What I'm talking about are the computercomputers, which now can be found in almost every home, and, of course, the mobile phone!
I toughtthought I would never need a mobile phone, but my mum and dad gave me one for Christmas last year and now I can't live without it!

But the discoveryinvention that I'm most thankful tofor is the computorcomputer and the Internet! Thanks to itthem, I can easyeasily communicate with my family and friends at home when I'm here in England. It's so quick and not too expensive either. To use the mobile phone, by the way, is very expensive. I usually use it for sending SMS Messages to my friends.

So, I start every day, by swichingswitching on my mobile phone, to see if there are any more SMS messages before I go to the library to check my e-mail and that's just the beginingbeginning of the day...
